Posts.EditableText:
Does Quest have a size limit on games.  I have been putting the finishing touches on my game (the asl file is 2,422 kb: all text, no graphics or sounds or anything).

Anyway, right now if add a single line of code...any line of code.  Even if I make an object that was visible into an invisable object I get:

Runtime error 6  Overflow.

If I take away the last thing I did then the error goes away and the game runs.

Have I hit the ceiling on how much content I can use.  Do I have to start editing other aspects of the game to make room for the last few scenes or what.

Please help.
Posts.HTML:
Does Quest have a size limit on games. I have been putting the finishing touches on my game (the asl file is 2,422 kb: all text, no graphics or sounds or anything).

Anyway, right now if add a single line of code...any line of code. Even if I make an object that was visible into an invisable object I get:

Runtime error 6 Overflow.

If I take away the last thing I did then the error goes away and the game runs.

Have I hit the ceiling on how much content I can use. Do I have to start editing other aspects of the game to make room for the last few scenes or what.

Please help.

Posts.EditableText: There may be a limit of 32767 lines, or possible double that. If there is a limit at all, I would presume it would be 32767 or 65535.
Posts.HTML: There may be a limit of 32767 lines, or possible double that. If there is a limit at all, I would presume it would be 32767 or 65535.

Posts.EditableText: That overflow error looks more like you've tried to add to much to a single variable.
Posts.HTML: That overflow error looks more like you've tried to add to much to a single variable.

Posts.EditableText:
I thought Alex up'd the limit on lines to something like 4 mill (or whatever a double/long can get to - I think they're signed by default).

There could be a limit on the amount of space Quest uses to actually store it's own data...

Could you try adding a coment?
If it still fails, it's in the reading part of Quest, if not - it's in the processing/storing part.
Also, which Quest version are you using?
Posts.HTML:
I thought Alex up'd the limit on lines to something like 4 mill (or whatever a double/long can get to - I think they're signed by default).

There could be a limit on the amount of space Quest uses to actually store it's own data...

Could you try adding a coment?
If it still fails, it's in the reading part of Quest, if not - it's in the processing/storing part.
Also, which Quest version are you using?

Posts.EditableText: lyteside had a similar problem.  It's fixed if you use the most recent version of the compiler.
Posts.HTML: lyteside had a similar problem.  It's fixed if you use the most recent version of the compiler.

Posts.EditableText:
I am using the newest version of Quest (4.02 I think).  I noticed last night that if I take away some material from anyplace than I have space to add new material.  

I think I have found the limits of this software.

I do not have much to add...I have taken out the in game hint system and will provide that as an extra file.  I believe that this will open enough room for me to code the ending....I hope.

Hey Alex...are you there....what do you think?
